newsitem.title: USA: CIMA Labs adopts shareholder rights plan.
newsitem.headline: CIMA Labs adopts shareholder rights plan.

text.p: CIMA Labs Inc said Friday its board of directors adopted a preferred share purchase right plan.

Under the plan stockholders will receive one right to purchase one one-hundredth of a share of a new series of preferred stock for each outstanding share of CIMA common stock held on the close of business on April 10.
CIMA said the rights plan is aimed at protecting shareholders in the event an unsolicited attempt is made to acquire the company.
The adoption of the plan is intended as a means to guard against abusive takeover tactics, the company said, and is not in response to any proposal to acquire CIMA.

The rights will be treated as a non-taxable dividend and will expire in 10 years. The rights will be exercisable only if a person or group acquires 15 percent or more of the CIMA common stock or announces a tender offer for 15 percent or more of the common stock.
CIMA said its board may terminate the plan at any time or redeem the rights.
CIMA develops products based primarily upon its OraSolv oral dosage form technology for marketing by multinational pharmaceutical companies.
